response.answer_text: Yes, because all tautologies are true and when you are the thing that you are defining then that definition is not subject to any other conditions for validity. Whether the argument for an argument itself is sound is a different matter. In other terms, ‘do questions exist?’ is ironically undecidable in its own terms. Similarly, if you are what you say you are then no-one else can refute that but only because everything else is arbitrarily irrelevant. Circles do not connect to any other curves. There are no consequences for them. So, you are an absolute truth unto yourself, but that does not apply in any other sense.

No. The only One who can be absolute truth, is God Himself. We are human beings who are capable of telling lies. God, however, is not. Numbers 23:19 God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good? Or, if you want an easier translation; God is not human, that he should lie, not a human being, that he should change his mind.Does he speak and then not act? Does he promise and not fulfill?

If you are, You wouldn’t ask. For instance ; a mentally healthy human wondering if he or she is a human . You don’t even ask, you know that you are. Once you ask, at that particular moment of questioning . You have ultimately forgotten what is, that is if you knew right from the get-go what is and what isn’t.
You are an intrinsic and insoluble part of the absolute truth. You are the eternal soul and you are part and parcel of the Supreme Being.
God is the only absolute truth, and every man is a lie.
